2. Lusty Joker - Played cards with Heart suit give +3 Mult when scored - $5

Boosters:
1. Standard Pack - $4
2. Standard Pack - $4

Vouchers:
1. Hieroglyph - -1 Ante, -1 hand each round - $10

Reroll cost: $5

**Analysis:**

The Hieroglyph voucher is interesting - it reduces the Ante by 1 (making progress easier) but also reduces hands per round by 1, which could be problematic. With $11, I can afford it with $1 left over. However, reducing hands might hurt my ability to win rounds, especially with Merry Andy already reducing my hand size.

The Magician could be useful to create Lucky Cards (1 in 5 chance for +20 Mult, 1 in 15 chance to win $20), but I'd need to identify good target cards in my deck.

Lusty Joker would give +3 Mult per Heart card scored. Looking at my hand composition, I don't have a particularly strong Heart focus, so this might not be the best fit.


Standard Packs are pricey at $4 each but could help me find better cards. My joker lineup has some weak spots—Green Joker is barely contributing at +1 Mult, while Zany Joker, Splash, and Mystic Summit are doing heavy lifting. I should consider whether selling Green Joker makes sense if I find a stronger replacement.

With $11 available before the Big Blind and Boss rounds, I'm weighing three main options: investing $3 in The Magician to convert frequently-played cards into Lucky Cards (which offer a 1 in 5 shot at +20 Mult), rerolling the shop for better jokers or cards, or buying a Standard Pack. Since I've been relying on Pairs and Three of a Kind, enhancing cards that fit those patterns could compound my damage significantly.

The Hieroglyph voucher is also tempting at $10—it drops my Ante from 3 to 2, meaning lower chip requirements for the remaining blinds, which is a major advantage. The trade-off is losing one hand per round, though my Merry Andy joker's +3 discards should help mitigate that constraint.

Comparing my options—The Magician ($3), a reroll ($5), or a Standard Pack ($4)—the Hieroglyph's value of essentially skipping an entire Ante tier seems strongest strategically.

The Magician's appeal is converting cards to Lucky Cards with decent upside—the +20 Mult or $20 payouts could compound my damage. I'd want to target high-frequency cards like face cards and Aces that show up in my Pairs and Three of a Kinds. My current damage engine relies on Zany Joker's Three of a Kind bonus and Splash making all cards count, so adding Lucky variance to my most-played cards could be a meaningful boost. The question is whether that upside justifies the opportunity cost of what I'd have to sacrifice. to Ante 3. Since I only have $1 and can't afford anything right now, and my Three of a Kind strategy is already performing well, I could just move forward and save my jokers. But selling Green Joker for The Magician feels like the stronger play—Green Joker isn't pulling its weight, and The Magician's Lucky Card synergy could significantly boost my multiplier output. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
